triples.name: Boolean satisfiability problem
triples.relevance: The core problem discussed in this handbook of satisfiability research and applications.

triples.name: SAT solver
triples.relevance: Modern SAT solvers are the key enabling technology whose dramatic improvements are discussed in the handbook.

triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: A major application area for SAT solvers in automated verification of both hardware and software.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The umbrella technique using SAT solvers for automated verification of computer hardware and software systems.

triples.name: Hardware verification
triples.relevance: A primary application domain where bounded model checking and SAT solvers are widely used.

triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: An emerging application area for SAT-based techniques and decision procedures in program verification.

triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: A specification language used in bounded model checking to express temporal properties verified using SAT.

triples.name: Decision problem
triples.relevance: The fundamental computational concept underlying satisfiability and decision procedures used in SAT-based verification.

triples.name: Bit array
triples.relevance: Represents bit-vectors used in decision procedures for program verification with bit-vector arithmetic.

triples.name: Linear algebra
triples.relevance: Provides mathematical foundation for decision procedures on linear real and integer arithmetic used in verification.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: A related technique to SAT solving that uses decision procedures and SAT solvers for automated verification.
